comment: First, his accent is extremely thick making him hard to understand and hear sometimes, and his voice doesn't carry. Secondly, he spends the entire class doing proofs of all problems instead of examples its unhelpful. Lastly, there are study guides alike to the test unless you want to get a tutor it'll be hard but if you're already good at calc idm.

If your stuck with this professor being the only option left, you might as well just wait another whole semester. Avoid him at all cost possible. His accent is VERY difficult to understand and his syllabus grading criteria was so wrong. NO partial credit, NO final exam replacing a test grade, NO help at all.

I think Professor Yang gets a bad wrap. The accent isn't as bad as most people say and he is very kind, he will not make you feel like an idiot if you ask a question. He can go into tangents about proofs you don't need to know for the test. I mostly learned from YouTube videos online. His study guides are very helpful though.

Study Guides = Test

tests = the study guides. he will break down all study guide Qs in class before test. you can email him for it too.He let me make up the exam during midterms b/c i got a bad grade while worrying about my 5 other exams.very flexible & teaches everything you need to know. nothing more. withdrew from a diff professor; he's amazing for the tough class.
Not a bad class. Study guides are exactly the test which is great. Answer questions during class and never makes you feel dumb.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Bo Yang has a very thick accent that is hard to understand when he is explaining math. He is not very helpful when answering questions. I had to retake the class because I couldn't understand the material with his teaching style.

The professor is so boring and reads off a PowerPoint. Had him at 8 am in the morning and was waiting for the class to end. Professor Yang just keeps repeating. the information and no one participates in the class because we didn't understand the material. All the work is on ALEKS and you basically learn off there. Professor Yang is a nice person.

Very knowledgeable, but overcomplicates his long/boring lectures. Does not offer extra credit. Began to take attendance around the middle of the semester. Only grades 3 tests, a final, and homework. Does not put grades in until the very end of the semester. Inaccessible outside of class, not very organized with communication... Would not recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Lectures are straight to the point, but be ready for alot of self teaching at home for the test. Grade is basically 4 test a final and homework with no curve on anything. Class is NO CALCULATOR which screwed me over. Be ready for alot of studyig.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The class material is not difficult. Bo Yang is clearly a very smart guy, but when it comes to explanations, he needs improvement. He typically over explains topics that are simple to understand but become over complicated when he begins to explain it. However, he usually emails a set of practice problems before the tests that help significantly.

The class is just a refresher of high school algebra, so it's not too difficult. Professor Yang just reads off a PowerPoint and does example problems. Homework is assigned on ALEKS and it's really helpful and a good supplement to the lectures. The test has the same exact type of problems as the study guide, so the tests aren't too difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Yang is a boring teacher who reads straight off the powerpoint. All the homework is on Aleks and there is a test given out on paper. The homework on aleks is a lot of topics and you basically learn off there. The class is mostly self-taught and aleks was a lot of work.
Study guides are almost identical to tests. Very boring lectures, but super knowledgeable and will answer any questions you have. Really hard quizzes that are theorem-based!

Dr. Yang is very nice, and obviously very intelligent. He does not exceed at delivering the material effectively. Too much time spent on theorems, too few real examples, and very little coding in the structure of the class. Since the class is about iteration it should be predominant coding.

Gave 5 tests, 6 quizzes and a final. He gives a study guide for each test (except the final as the questions are taken from the tests). The study guides are exactly like the test but different numbers. If you know how to do the problems on the study guides, you should get an A on the tests. No study guides for quizzes but they aren't worth as much.

The tests were like the study guides he gave, with a different equation given on the test. He read over powerpoints for lecture. If you study the crap out of the studyguide, you will make a solid grade on the tests. The tests are 4 questions and there are 5 tests overall. The final is 10 questions chosen randomly from the tests given in class.

This is a difficult one as I like Yang for other classes. He was not prepared for this class and it hurt all the students. It started with just giving 300 example problems from the internet and saying work on them. It was not until the 2nd of 4 tests he restructured to actually teach the material properly. He's incredibly nice and tries though.

He is alright. His tests are just the practice tests with different numbers. His lecture on the other hand was just videos of him reading the textbook word for word. I crammed a few hours before the tests and pulled a B. If you try it is an easy A, if you are looking for an easy way to get this class out of the way, this is the class to take.

MATH 3332 Almost lectures word for word on notes, so lectures were hard to get through. Examples from notes help prepare you for the exercises, and the exercises help prepare you for the homework, and the homework helps prepare you for the test.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Pros: Attendance is not mandatory, there is no textbook (also a con), no homework Cons: Lecture heavy, AWFUL with communicating through email or giving any extra help, the first few tests are easy, then get ready to bomb the last few. I got an A in calc 3 and managed to get a B in this class, but I wouldn't know why because he doesn't respond.
PLEASE avoid taking this professor. Doesnt explain well. Too many exams in a semester. If you can please avoid and take someone better. You wont learn anything in this class.

Gives reviews class before and covers the questions step by step. He does not stray from his review whatsoever. As long as the review is studied then should have no issue with test. Unlike other professors he is not proof heavy. This is a good thing for the applied mathematics majors so they get more actual work and less proofs.

Pros: His tests are exactly like his study guides and he gives the solutions the day before the test. Attendance is not mandatory. Con: Does not present material in a mathematically rigorous way. Want to fall asleep in his lectures. There is no student-professor interaction Partial credit is not given on the tests.

I took him for set theory and was surprised at how petty he was. He yelled at someone for saying "Bless you" once. He never explained the "why" behind what he lectured and if we asked, he repeated what he had said before. He didn't even tell us the material which would be on each test. If you have to take him, be ready for surprises and extra work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I also had him for Linear Algebra, Set Logic Proofs, and Diffrential equations. If you need an easy A for Linear then take him. Otherwise, Id try looking for a different prof for the other classes. 5 exams and a final. No homework, he provides test book links. Never used them. I never know whats going on until he goes over the review. Then I cram
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Yang is a moderate professor. He is VERY boring in class, and barely acknowledges anyone. He does explain everything clearly. Only gives 2 short homework assignments all semester. The biggest plus (to me) about this class was that he posts practice exams and keys before each exam and they're very similar. Good for someone right out of HS.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor CAN NOT TEACH. You don't feel comfortable asking questions, he never answers them but repeats what he previously stated like a broken record. Grade only consists of tests, and it's impossible to recover your grade after one bad test. Concepts in this class are VERY hard to grasp. Being an intro class, it should not be this hard.

I have taken three courses with him(linear algebra, differential eq, proofs/logic). Verdict: Take him for linear algebra easy A. Diff eq is average if your semi good at math. Avoid Proofs with him at all costs. Show up for reviews, do problems exactly like him, and self teach/outside resources are key components to doing well in his classes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He's not the greatest. He barely acknowledges the class at all. Students will sit with their hands up for 5 to 10 minutes before he even notices. It's very easy to zone out in his class, and most people just don't show up. He, and the content are very straightforward though, so if you need Math, but no bells and whistles, he's the prof for you.

He's a good teacher and understands his topic well, but he doesn't interact with the class much. Often I'd find that he rarely even turns around to see if people have questions. That being said the content is straight forward to me and the tests have not been punishing. He has a very dry way of teaching, so keep that in mind. It won't be exiting.

5 exams, same as study guides, study guides are posted online, and attendance is optional. You literally only need to show up on exam days. However, he gives solutions to the study guide in class only, so just go to class starting like a week before exam. Grades exams out of 64, so a small errror can cost big points, so be careful on his exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you need to know the material or have dreams of becoming a mathematician/understanding deep theory, DO NOT take him. However, if you just need an easy A or B, then 100% TAKE HIM! Study guides are 100% identical to the exam except for a number changed here and there. Harsh graded in terms of partial credit, but you can easily a 100 on all exams.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you want to be challenged take this course in marietta. If you want to know the basic principles of the course take him. I personally enjoyed his class. Study guide is about the same as the test. Don't bother emailing him he doesn't respond.

Prof Yang is the most coherent, straightforward math teacher I've ever had. He teaches a class as a college level course should be taught; he lectures, then he tests you. It's that simple. Learn the material and you'll ace the tests. He gives well-paced lectures and also provides study guides that are almost exactly like the tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His study guide are very similar to the exam and final exam. Just know your study guide and you will fine for the exam. For final exam, review your study guides and exams. Its an easy class.

He uploads the documents online and explains them in class. Pretty easy A if you pay attention in class which is tough since lectures are boring. There are 3 tests and a final which are all basically like the study guide. He is accessible during office hours only since he wouldn't respond to emails are texts.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The professor uploads documents that he basically reads through explaining everything in the class. He goes over a bunch of proofs which is not necessary for tests. Had 3 tests and final were basically study guide with different numbers. He is friendly but does not respond to texts or emails. Accent is heavy but you get used to it after a day or 2

I took this class in the summer when it was 4 hours twice a week. Difficult to focus but gives a break at the end of each hour. Overall good teacher but gave us tests 3 weeks in a row after waiting 3 weeks to give us the first two tests. I struggled to grasp the material but to be honest I still really enjoyed the class. Only 4 tests and 2 homework
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: It sucks that he is the only teacher who taught Linear Algebra in the summer. We would ask questions in class and he would repeat what he just said. He NEVER replied to an email. He gave you a study guide but rarely put the answers up. If you don't know the exact format he wants the answer to be in then the entire thing is wrong.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's very tough on his grading but he also gives homework that directly reflects the tests. If you can do the homework, you can do the tests. Just make sure you know your formulas. Unfortunately, he's a boring lecturer so if you can stay awake you'll do great. Also, he's a very impressive artist on the whiteboard.

Pretty much what everyone is saying.  Tests are exactly like the homework, just with the numbers changed. Make sure to double check everything though, because he is brutal when it comes to partial credit. I lost over half credit for a missing negative sign. Other than that, do your homework and you'll be fine.
Easy tests, just like homework. I honestly don't understand anything, but as far as grades go, just follow the procedure for the problem.

5 tests, 6 homeworks, 1 final. One homework per exam including the final. Exams are nearly identical to the homeworks with just a couple of number switches. Do well on the homeworks  and understand them and you'll have no problem making a 100 in the class.
He's the man, and he doesnt get butt hurt if you dont go to class. Tests are exactly like the hw.

Bo Yang's class is awesome.He makes it easy to succeed if you put in a little time. The tests are EXACTLY like the hw, but with different numbers. The final is identical to the last hw given, but with different numbers. He is quite hard to understand at times, but I loved listening to his accent. Use Linear Alg. Toolkit to check your work as you go

Prof. Yang is an awesome teacher- his tests are quite similar to the HW. The HW is due day of the test. I hardly understand much of what he teaches in class(first time this ever happened to me)BUT because I have to research the HW, Iâ€™ve learned much more than I thought possible with his way of lecturing.Strict grader though.. Highly recommend!

This is the second time I have taken this professor, and he is the easiest math professor I have ever taken. I received and A both times. He gives you 5 homeworks and 5 tests. The homework is exactly like the test except for minor changes, and he goes over a similar version of the homework before it is due. Attendance not mandatory

Very structured class homework is the only study material needed for the test, and formula sheets are allowed. Easiest higher math teacher period (everyone knows it). Slightly confusing in class, assuming the class is on his level, but he doesn't mind staying after.
This class was really easy with him. He gives you homework that is just like the test with minor changes and goes over another version so you know what you are doing. I strongly recommend him.

Summer section.  4 Homework assignments ~8 problems each.  Tests are just like the homework with some of the numbers/functions changed.  His way of explaining things is maybe a little unorthodox.  Overall good professor and I will take him again.

The easiest math class I've taken. He gives you hw to turn in before the test which is almost identical to the test. Therefore do the hw, know the hw, get a 100 on the test. Easy. Class isn't mandatory, the book helps in areas you may need help in. He will answer questions too.

If you enjoy math, you will enjoy this class. The lecture is systematic and easy to follow. Proofs are presented in class to further understand the material. If you're good at math, this class will not be difficult.

I don't know why people are saying he is so hard. He lets you use formula sheets with the test. He gives you a study guide of what the test will be and it is almost the exact same as the test. He gives homework grades, but you are allowed to redo the ones you miss for full credit. He makes sure that  you know everything you need to for the test :)

This guy was awful. Yes he has an accent but it is more his teaching style, or lack thereof, than ruined it for me. He just works through problems with minimal explanation, if any, relating to why he does what or what you're trying to achieve. He would even start new material not on an upcoming test several days before actually giving the test.

He was terrible, I didn't learn a thing. One day he wrote an equation on the board, solved it, and moved on. Some of us asked how he solved it and he told us "Oh, it just comes naturally." then continued without any further instructions.
intense summer cores did great, online notes were useful, neatness count, lots of ways to improve your grade.

He tries to help, hence the higher of the exam average or the final will be 2/3 of your grade. Hard to learn from. Its not really the accent. Its just Youtube is more instructful. Assigns homework but it is never graded. Exams are the only grades in the class.

WOW! This teacher is horrible. He NEVER uses live examples...reads off ppts verbadum which clearly aren't his b/c he doesn't speak alot of english.Doesn't put effort into what he teaches. He makes your highest test count for more than the lowest to make up for his horrible teaching or else everyone would fail his class. I love math but he sucks.

I really don't like math, so his trig class was shot from the start. He doesn't understand questions or how to answer them, but if you take the notes and memorize the study guides...well it got me through. I know a lot of ppl weren't so lucky tho

He is a REALLY bad teacher! He is oriental so really hard to understand and he doesn't get it when you don't understand what he is trying to teach. The key to aceing his class is to be there on the review day before the test with your practice test and write down all the answers and work because they are almost the same problems just diff numbers.

His class was awful!!! If you already don't know it, don't take the class. He is hard to understand and doesn't help you at all. If he tries o help you, he usually just confuses you more. his tests were hard and he doesn't grade easy. Only take him if you have to.
Yang knows calc inside and out, everything there is to know. He just chooses not to really share it with you... he just does it no help unless you hound him for it.. not suggested

teaches a new method for solving the same equation each time which can be amusing and even beneficial. Problem is he zips through (maybe because I took it in summer) which makes the different methods confusing. A lot of time you will find that he teaches the most involved and complicated method to solve anything.

I disagree with many of the comments posted. Overall, I think Yang is a great professor. He goes through the material pretty fast, but if you ask a question he'll explain it alot simpler. He gives out study sheets which go coherently with the exam. If you study these and review your notes, you will do well in the class. His accent is not bad at all
His accent is hard to understand at first but you can fail all of his test and get a B because of the system in which he grades his tests and the final exam.

Terrible.  Terrible.  I could barely understand him, and everything said about him is rather accurate.  I am not a math person and I really needed help and he was not willing to help me out.  He was very frustrated with us all, all of the time.  Way too much info at once, board writing sucked, gave bad breakdowns of how to do the problems, etc. I failed, then took another teacher the next semester, realized calculus is pretty easy, and got a B
Ehh..I have him this semster. The accent isn't that bad, just wish he'd speak up!! Too many definitions, not enough problems being worked.
hard to understand and not very helpful, but the tests are easy IF YOU STUDY because the practice exams he gives you are very similar.

Well BO YANG....first off his accent is not that bad you can understand him pretty well.  He's not really a good teacher b/c he jus writes on the board without any student interaction..but he does put practice tests n finals on his website...HELPFUL..u dont really need to go to class...A if u try

Needs to take several educational classes to gain skills in teaching,definitely knows content but straight lecturing with no engagement of his students. Does more examples AFTER a test than before and is unresponsive to his students
His accent can get pretty bad but he tries very hard.  Doesn't go over material fast.  Repeats easily if you ask him.  Overall, he is fine.
